Both "The New World" and "The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society" are excellent choices if you're looking for historical tales that delve into different aspects of history.

"The New World" offers an intriguing exploration of the English colonization of Virginia, focusing on Pocahontas' life and relationships during this time. Meanwhile, "The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society" takes you to the aftermath of World War II in Guernsey Island, where a writer uncovers a hidden secret among its residents.

Enjoy your movie nights!

This film, set in China during the 1860s, follows three warlords joining forces against rebels and features some captivating performances by actors like Andy Lau and Takeshi Kaneshiro.

Another intriguing choice is "Schindler's List" (1993), a powerful historical drama that tells the story of Oskar Schindler, an industrialist who saves his Jewish workers from persecution by the Nazis. The film stars Liam Neeson and has earned critical acclaim for its moving portrayal of this significant historical event. Enjoy your movie time!
